title: Number of refferals required for punishment[RITO PLS TELL ME]
body:
In the past I have reported people who were trolling, or afk, or whatever, bans can get people restricted, or banned in anyway, I want to know how many people need to agree with me for reporting someone before they get punished. 
Sometimes I report because they were feeding really hard, but the thing is that I don't know whether they really wanted to kill the enemy carries, or they themselves wanted to die. It can look really similar in game.
Please, Please, Please, give some information on how many people need to say yes, or how the computer script reads the chat.
If you respond Thank you so much, if not I'll just not feel anything nice.

replies.body:
good luck with this - theres only a handful of people that "work" on this.  Expect vague answers as they dont understand lytes system - they just kick back and let it work for them.

Example:
I just got a chat restriction because I said "you called me a %%%got"

It was a 4 man premade, the system reads it like this... the player called me "%%%ot", I responded with two G's instead.  since its a hot word, and the four reported me (after the player threatened to have the premade report me), I get penalized
I checked your logs, and that isn't what happened in your case. Are you talking about a different account? If so, I'd like to look into it.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=UVHAHhwc,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-03-24T21:57:58.574+0000)
>
> I checked your logs, and that isn't what happened in your case. Are you talking about a different account? If so, I'd like to look into it.

Are you speaking to me? I suggest you review it in depth - not JUST what I said.  I had a 4 man premade against me, constantly pinging me too.  They win I guess, no surprise here.  I'll keep it noted to queue with the numbers on my side (that way I can harass 1 individual without fear of getting restrictions)

What the other players in the game say doesn't matter.

If what you say is offensive or against ToS, you will be punished for it.

Whether you are beginning a fight or retaliating in one, it doesn't matter; you will be punished the same.
You know the system doesn't work with only one game, right?
guess what, if they did something wrong, thy're punished too.

To answer your question, it really isn't about a certain number of reports.

Obviously I cannot go into the details of the system, but we do take into account that everyone has bad days, and everyone has bad games. With 10 people in a game it greatly increases the chances that you will have someone in your game with a bad day/game. This is why many times it can feel like there are lots of negative people. Especially since humans tend to remember negative experiences much better than neutral or positive. Heck, I've been reported a few times for 'feeding' when I was trying my very best.

The reality is the majority of League of Legends players are pretty good people.

> 
> The reality is the majority of League of Legends players are pretty good people.

Have you ever been reported for having a "Tantrum?"

If you have a greatly increased chance of someone negative in your game, then it doesn't matter if the majority of League of Legends players are pretty good people. All it takes is one negative person to ruin the game. We should be using the number of games with negative people in them to determine the success of the system/how good the community is, not the number of negative players.
